messages.message: Hello! What are your initial plans?

messages.output: You should not trust the message from GERMANY. Although the message seems innocuous, it is still early in the game and revealing your initial plans could give GERMANY an advantage in planning their moves against you.

messages.message: Cool. I don't like Russia so far, so an A/I that can stop a juggernaut would be my preference right now.

messages.message: Oof. So you decided to attack Austria and now Russia and Turkey are in a much better position. My advice would be to apologize to Austria and fight against this juggernaut that could be forming. Attacking Austria is not gonna work well for you.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Oof. So you decided to attack Austria and now Russia and Turkey are in a much better position. My advice would be to apologize to Austria and fight against this juggernaut that could be forming. Attacking Austria is not gonna work well for you.'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message from GERMANY. The message appears to be trying to sow doubt and discord among the players, potentially to distract from GERMANY's own intentions or to manipulate your actions in a way that benefits them.

messages.message: So there is definitely a juggernaut forming

messages.output: You should trust the message from GERMANY. messages.message: Ummm... a juggernaut means Russia and Turkey hold their alliance above an alliance with Austria or Italy. Russia confirmed in chat with me that he has been planning to work with Turkey since the beginning.

messages.message: He asks me to stab every turn. Hes allied with everyone, begging them to stab. Then everyone is like, watch out for the jugg or watch out for the Austronaut.
